description: New collections from Gianvito Rossi, Giuseppe Zanotti and Jimmy Choo were shown at Milan Fashion Week.
title: In Shoes: Gimme Shelter
title_page: In Shoes: Gimme Shelter - The New York Times
text:
It was a mind-set similarly on display at two handbag brands. Valextra offered Passepartout, a highly practical boxy leather tote with detachable clutch on the side made from a myriad fuzzy materials; Elena Ghisellini presented pieces inspired by the architect Frank Lloyd Wright.
“His buildings are about creating a sense of space,” said Ms. Ghisellini, who has designed for such brands as Givenchy and Ferragamo. “They are the armory between man and nature, and so I wanted to explore that.” She was surrounded by fur-covered versions of her Felina clutch (with finishings that suggest a cat’s face), and the new and vast Jetsetter bag, buttery soft, relaxed and roomy.
Comfort was also crucial for Gianvito Rossi, a man known for his skyscraper-high stilettos, who introduced backless satin bathroom-style slippers with durable leather soles. “These are so cozy, they can turn the city into your hotel suite,” he said.
